description: From Middle English lukky, equivalent to luck +‎ -y. Cognate with Scots lucky (“lucky”), West Frisian lokkich (“lucky, fortunate”), Dutch gelukkig (“lucky, fortunate, happy”). Compare also Danish lykkelig (“happy”), Swedish lycklig (“happy, lucky”), German glücklich (“happy”), Saterland Frisian glukkelk (“happy”).

adjectives.description: lucky (comparative luckier or more lucky, superlative luckiest or most lucky)

entries.meaning: (of people) Favoured by luck; fortunate; having good success or good fortune.
examples: Synonyms: fortunate, successful; see also Thesaurus:lucky
The downed pilot is very lucky to be alive.

entries.meaning: Producing, or resulting in, good fortune
examples: Synonyms: favorable, auspicious, favorable, fortunate; see also Thesaurus:auspicious
